definition: to warm up/to heat up/hot (of weather)/heat/fervent

sentences.english: The tastiest hot tea, does not sweeten.
If that doesn’t help, then drink a cup of hot tea along with some honey.
sentences.chinese: 如果不行的話，你可以喝一杯放有蜂蜜的熱茶。

sentences.english: The school also provided sleeping mats, coverlets, bath facilities and hot tea.
sentences.chinese: 學校給這些家長提供墊絮，牀單，洗浴設施及熱茶。

sentences.english: He calls for cakes and hot drinks all the time.
sentences.chinese: 他一刻不停地要點心和熱茶。

sentences.english: Immediately your nose is filled with the aroma of hot tea and roast sweet potatoes.
sentences.chinese: 燒山芋和熱茶的香味，便一下子撲人你的鼻子。

sentences.english: Happiness will be melting and spreading, just like browN sugaR meets hot tea.
sentences.chinese: 快樂由此如紅糖遇見熱茶般，融化和漫延。

sentences.english: Pour the hot tea into the mug and stir.
sentences.chinese: 將熱茶倒入杯中並且攪拌。

sentences.english: The white group mark that leaves on lacquer layer to heating up a teacup, usable cloth chafes .
sentences.chinese: 對熱茶杯在漆層上留下的白圈痕跡，可用布摩擦。

sentences.english: But if that doesn’t help, then drink a cup of hot tea along with some honey.
sentences.chinese: 如果不行的話，你可以喝一杯放有蜂蜜的熱茶。

sentences.english: A: You should take some hot tea and get a good sleep.
sentences.chinese: 你應該喝些熱茶，好好睡一覺。

sentences.english: Her father enjoys warm tea very much in summer.
sentences.chinese: 她的父親夏天非常愛喝熱茶。

sentences.english: After you’re done, drink some hot tea or chocolate and appreciate the moment.
sentences.chinese: 之後，喝些熱茶或者熱巧克力，享受這美好的一刻。

sentences.english: Sugar melts in the hot tea.
Pour rum and Cointreau into tea cup fill with English hot tea and top with milk.
sentences.chinese: 深蘭姆及君度入茶杯入英式熱茶上加牛奶。

definition: to eat and eat/to stuff oneself
variant of 熱乎乎|热乎乎[re4 hu1 hu1]
